body_html:
Seeing exactly the same phenomenon for the 2nd part of the issue reported. Though I can always get expected result if the interpreter is only invoked once.

When it is invoked for multiple times via the '-c' command line parameter I am no longer getting correct result. Meanwhile different incorrect results are returned based on the number of iterations specified. I had observed the same issue on both linux-x64 and raspberry-pi.

I made an attempt to enlarge the for-loop to include the step which sets up input tensor with resized image, then the issue is gone. Looks like the input had been altered in some way after a successful invoke call.

I made an attempt to enlarge the for-loop to include the step which sets up input tensor with resized image, then the issue is gone. Looks like the input had been altered in some way after a successful invoke call.
body:
Seeing exactly the same phenomenon for the 2nd part of the issue reported. Though I can always get expected result if the interpreter is only invoked once.

When it is invoked for multiple times via the '-c' command line parameter I am no longer getting correct result. Meanwhile different incorrect results are returned based on the number of iterations specified. I had observed the same issue on both linux-x64 and raspberry-pi.

I made an attempt to enlarge the for-loop to include the step which sets up input tensor with resized image, then the issue is gone. Looks like the input had been altered in some way after a successful invoke call.
